fields.label: Does your business utilize the exemptions for beneficial owner (Part 4.12) and politically exposed person (Part 4.13) identification as specified in Part 4.14?
Specifically, does your business provide a designated service of a type specified in Column 1 of the Table in Part 4.14 (e.g., bullion, gambling, or low-value superannuation services)?
Is your business exempt from Division 4 of Part 2 of the AML/CTF Act in accordance with the circumstances and conditions specified in Column 2 of the Table in Part 4.14?
Does your program include a procedure for limited and exceptional cases where a customer cannot provide satisfactory evidence of identity (Part 4.15)?
fields.detail-label: Describe the procedure and controls used to identify customers in limited and exceptional cases.

groups.title: Part 4.14: Exemptions relating to the identification of beneficial owners and politically exposed persons
groups.description: Details the specific conditions under which a reporting entity is not required to identify beneficial owners and PEPs, typically involving services with specific thresholds or existing regulatory exemptions (e.g., bullion <$5000, licensed gaming machines <15, or business transfers).

groups.title: Part 4.15: Procedure where customer cannot provide satisfactory evidence of identity
groups.description: Procedures for limited and exceptional cases where individuals cannot obtain or provide standard identity evidence, including those who are homeless, experiencing family violence, living in remote areas, or undocumented arrivals.
